snippet: Basing preference on socioeconomic factors, rather than race, is a superior method to providing disadvantaged people access to college educations, according to a new study by the Century Foundation.
abstract: Study by left-leaning policy group Century Foundation shows that giving college applicants preference based on socioeconomic factors, rather than race, is comparable to affirmative action in achieving racial diversity, and superior in helping people who are disadvantaged.
lead_paragraph: Basing preference on socioeconomic factors, rather than race, is a superior method to providing disadvantaged people access to college educations, according to a new study by the Century Foundation.

headline.seo: Benefits Seen in Considering Income for College Admissions
headline.main: Benefits Seen in Considering Income for College Admissions
headline.print_headline: Benefits Seen In Considering Income For Admissions
